publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-165 Stewart Stevenson: Mis-selling of Gas and Electricity-That the Parliament notes the recent survey by the Trading Standards Institute that revealed that as many as 1.4 milion households in the UK have suffered bad experiences from energy salespeople; further notes that energy companies such as Scottish Gas have taken over people's accounts without their permission; believes that mis-selling of gas and electricity is unacceptable, and supports Energywatch's "Stop Now" campaign, which aims to restore consumer confidence by condemning high-pressure doorstep sales. Supported by: Nora Radcliffe*, Chris Ballance*, Brian Adam*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Richard Lochhead*, Jim Mather*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Michael Matheson*, Patrick Harvie*, Alex Neil*
S2M-165 Mis-selling of Gas and Electricity (lodged on 18 June 2003) Robin Harper*, Fergus Ewing*, Christine Grahame*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Rob Gibson*, Shiona Baird*

S2M-165 Stewart Stevenson: Mis-selling of Gas and Electricity—That the Parliament notes the recent survey by the Trading Standards Institute that revealed that as many as 1.4 milion households in the UK have suffered bad experiences from energy salespeople; further notes that energy companies such as Scottish Gas have taken over people’s accounts without their permission; believes that mis-selling of gas and electricity is unacceptable, and supports Energywatch’s "Stop Now" campaign, which aims to restore consumer confidence by condemning high-pressure doorstep sales.
